metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40284 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow was discovered in NTFS-3G before 2022.10.3. Crafted metadata in an NTFS image can cause code execution. A local attacker can exploit this if the ntfs-3g binary is setuid root. A physically proximate attacker can exploit this if NTFS-3G software is configured to execute upon attachment of an external storage device.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libntfs-3g88 - 1:2017.3.23-2ubuntu0.18.04.5
ntfs-3g - 1:2017.3.23-2ubuntu0.18.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntfs-3g package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2017.3.23-2ubuntu0.18.04.5').
